    Vignette 1 -- PIC counting with 10X Cell Ranger output Vignette 2 -- PIC counting in Seurat/Signac workflow Vignette 3 -- PIC counting in ArchR workflow Vignette 4 -- PIC counting with dsc-ATAC-seq data Vignette 5 -- DAR analysis with PIC parametric framework

    given insertion rate, calculate theoretical distribution under condition 1 and 2

    dot-insertion_to_c12.Rd

    given insertion rate, calculate theoretical distribution under condition 1 and 2

    Usage

    .insertion_to_c12(
  insertion_rates = (1:2000) * 0.01,
  peak_lengths = 4:20 * 50,
  pad_length = 0,
  dirs = c(-1, 1),
  count_type = "fragment",
  min_frag_length = 25,
  max_frag_length = 600,
  cap_insertion = 20
)

    Arguments

    insertion_rates

    A vector of insertion rates, note that the insertion rate is per 1000 base, so the default range is from 0.001 to 20

    peak_lengths

    A vector of peak length ranges, default is from 200 to 1000

    pad_length

    how many bp outside of peaks can insertions happen, default = 0

    dirs

    directions. default (-1, 1)

    count_type

    what type of count should we estimate, default 'fragment'

    min_frag_length

    minimum of fragment length, default 25

    max_frag_length

    maximum of fragment length, default 600

    cap_insertion

    maximum number of insertions that can simultaneously happen within one peak region

    Value

    A insertion rate by peak length matrix, and each element of the matrix corresponds to the number of expected fragments #' @noRd

    On this page
